article.title: Introduction to WinMerge
article.para: WinMerge is an Open Source differencing and merging tool for Windows. WinMerge can compare both folders and files, presenting differences in a visual text format that is easy to understand and handle.

WinMerge is highly useful for determining what has changed between project versions, and then merging changes between versions. WinMerge can be used as an external differencing/merging tool or as a standalone application.

In addition, WinMerge has many helpful supporting features that make comparing, synchronising, and merging as easy and useful as possible. Several programming languages and other file formats are syntax-highlighted.

The goal of WinMerge development is to make comparing, synchronizing, and merging folders and files easy and fast, while maintaining maximum reliability. Ease of use is of key importance for reducing errors.

WinMerge is licensed under GPL. It is a non-commercial product that depends on voluntary contributions. Please honor your license agreement and submit improvements to us. We are happy to get help improving WinMerge, to the advantage of all WinMerge users.

section.title: WinMerge versions WinMerge versions
section.para: There are two kinds of versions available in the downloads page.

section.title: stable versions Stable versions
section.para: Stable versions are recommended for most users. If you are unsure about what version to use, use the latest stable version. Stable version numbers comprise three parts which are all nonzero.

section.title: preview WinMerge versions Preview versions
section.para: Preview versions are for people who want to test latest features and improvements made after last stable version. Be warned that preview versions are likely to have bugs. Preview version numbers comprise four parts, the first of which is always zero. These releases are made available to allow users to try out the current code without needing to compile, and to participate in development discussions concerning new and changing features. We also appreciate any help testing the current code. Use preview versions with care and enable backups! And please report bugs that you find while using these builds: it really helps with WinMerge development!

section.title: WinMerge support reporting bugs Getting support and reporting bugs
section.para: The Open Discussion forum is the fastest way to get help. Please be patient, it may take some time for somebody to answer.

If you find a bug, please submit it to the issue tracker. Please attach as much information as you can: at a minimum, the version number of WinMerge that you are using. If you can, also attach a configuration log which, you can display by clicking Help Configuration in the WinMerge window. Good information in a bug report makes it more likely that your bug will be fixed quickly.

important.para: Include the version number in bug reports. You can check the version number by clicking Help About WinMerge .

section.title: WinMerge development WinMerge source code and development
section.para: WinMerge source code is embedded into distribution archives in the form of an archive named sources.7z. You can also obtain a development snapshot from the source code repository. WinMerge development is open for your ideas, so don't hesitate to share them on Open Discussion forum. You can also submit patches to the issue tracker.
